review_blob:
Great from the Epic taproom. Smooth fairly easy drinking IPA. Nice way to start a Friday. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good aroma but hop flavor is somewhat overpowered by maltiness. Certainly decent, but there are better IPAs, no question. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not one of Great Divide's best but satisfactory. Finish is almost burnt but packs a nice punch. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Adherents of the German Purity Law of 1516 will need to avoid as this contains illegal ingredients.  I am not a blueberry lover either but I tried this in Bar Harbor Maine and was definitely impressed. Aroma is good and taste is definitely laced with blueberries but not overpowering.  A respectable and well suited beer for summer thirsts, smooth and quaffable.
Blood red with a champagne-like head. Good aroma with a hint of wood. My wife liked and she doesn't like beer so I would not classify this as true beer. Great dessert drink but not made for quaffing.

Had at The Mitre pub, a cold and unfriendly place. Thankfully the beer was good. Nice brownish color with fruity flavor and almost wooden aroma. Not bitter but smooth and complements the pub food nicely.

Dickens Tavern, London. Watery and light yet smooth. Great lookng beer though but almost no trace of hops. Virtually no head and no alcohol. After four pints I felt full and like I had drank four pints of water.
beer_name: John Smiths Original Bitter / Extra Smooth

review_blob: Watery with little hop flavor or aroma. Golden colored and best served cold. Hard to find good Fosters in the U.S. The export factor and distances usually result in a less than fresh beer. Still, there is something appealing about the oil can that says "Yeah, I don't have to visit the cooler or fridge for awhile" Good party beer.

Nice reddish color with a hint of fruit and bitterness. Smooth and refreshing like a lager but retaining the color and fruity flavors of an ale. Simply a great beer good with food or a few rounds at the local bar.

Found this my last night in England at a rather bargain price pub in the Paddington district. Nice amber color but watery with little hint of hops. A bit too smooth for my taste. Yorkshire's finest but not great. Hate to try their worst.
There are worse beers. Good after a game of volleyball but not for quaffing. Strawberry flavor is not overpowering like Sam Adams Cherry wheat, but I believe in the German Purity Law of 1516.

As ordinary as beer comes. Tremendous marketing but adjunct ingredients detract from overall impression. Usually the cheapest and most widely found beer in U.S. bars and restaurants but if you can afford better then invest.

While available in a bottle, the best way to enjoy this is in a London pub. I am happy to say I have had the privelege of enjoying this from cask. Enjoy at room temperature. Amber, aromatic, hoppy flavor, light carbonation good malt. Cask ale ideal for multiple refills.
